page.title: 01Thirsk and Sowerby N.Yorks.
page.content: {Location:}About 23 miles North of York, on the Al9. To the East are the North York Moors, to the West are the Yorkshire Dales. {Site:}On fairly flat land, in the Vale of York. Building has taken place on both sides of the Cod Beck. {Population:}Thirsk is a small market town with a population of 3185. The village of Sowerby is joined onto Thirsk and has a population of 3432 {Market Days:}Mondays,Saturdays and Bank Holidays.Held in the Market Square, a cobbled area of about two acres. {Churches:}St.Mary Magdelene(Thirsk), St.Oswalds(Sowerby),Thirsk and and Sowerby Methodist Chapels, Catholic Church, The Friends Meeting House (Quakers), The Kingdom Hall (Jehovah's Witnesses) {Major Hotels:}Three Tuns,Golden Fleece
